I have a pandas dataframe with two columns, and I am trying to plot it using seaborn. However, the plot is currently being ordered by the "Dim" column, while I want it to be ordered by the "Count" column. How can I achieve this? Here's the code I have currently:

```python
dicti=({'37':99943,'25':47228,'36':16933,'40':14996,'35':11791,'34':8030,'24' : 6319 ,'2'  :5055 ,'39' :4758 ,'38' :4611  })
pd_df = pd.DataFrame(list(dicti.iteritems()))
pd_df.columns =["Dim","Count"]
plt.figure(figsize=(12,8))
ax = sns.barplot(x="Dim", y= "Count",data=pd_df )
ax.get_yaxis().set_major_formatter(plt.FuncFormatter(lambda x, loc: "
{:,}".format(int(x))))
ax.set(xlabel="Dim", ylabel='Count')
for item in ax.get_xticklabels():
    item.set_rotation(90)
for i, v in enumerate(pd_df["Count"].iteritems()):        
    ax.text(i ,v[1], "{:,}".format(v[1]), color='m', va ='bottom', 
    rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
```

To order the plot by the "Count" column rather than the "Dim" column, you need to sort the DataFrame by the "Count" column before plotting. Here's how you can modify your code to achieve that:

```python
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Your original dictionary
dicti = {'37': 99943, '25': 47228, '36': 16933, '40': 14996, '35': 11791, 
         '34': 8030, '24': 6319, '2': 5055, '39': 4758, '38': 4611}

# Convert dictionary to DataFrame
pd_df = pd.DataFrame(list(dicti.items()), columns=["Dim", "Count"])

# Sort the DataFrame by "Count" in descending order
pd_df = pd_df.sort_values(by="Count", ascending=False)

# Plotting
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
ax = sns.barplot(x="Dim", y="Count", data=pd_df)

# Formatting the y-axis labels
ax.get_yaxis().set_major_formatter(plt.FuncFormatter(lambda x, loc: "{:,}".format(int(x))))

# Setting labels
ax.set(xlabel="Dim", ylabel='Count')

# Rotating x-axis labels
for item in ax.get_xticklabels():
    item.set_rotation(90)

# Annotating the bars with the respective counts
for i, v in enumerate(pd_df["Count"]):
    ax.text(i, v, "{:,}".format(v), color='m', va='bottom', rotation=45)

# Adjust layout
plt.tight_layout()

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

In this modified code, the `pd_df = pd_df.sort_values(by="Count", ascending=False)` line ensures that the DataFrame is sorted by the "Count" column in descending order before being passed to the `seaborn` barplot function. This way, the plot will display the bars ordered by "Count".
